author: niroyb
body:
"Get-Process" fails but not "ls"

```
PS C:\Users\niroy> Invoke-Command -ComputerName 10.123.174.166 -Credential $Credential -Authentication Basic -ScriptBloc
k { Get-Process }

Handles  NPM(K)    PM(K)      WS(K) VM(M)   CPU(s)     Id  SI ProcessName                  PSComputerName
-------  ------    -----      ----- -----   ------     --  -- -----------                  --------------
              0        0          0     0              96   0 acpi_thermal_pm              10.123.174.166
The member "Handlecount" is not present.
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Get-Process], ExtendedTypeSystemException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : AliasLookupMemberNotPresent,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetProcessCommand
    + PSComputerName        : 10.123.174.166



PS C:\Users\niroy> Invoke-Command -ComputerName 10.123.174.166 -Credential $Credential -Authentication Basic -ScriptBloc
k { ls }


    Directory: /home/powershell


Mode                LastWriteTime         Length Name                                PSComputerName
----                -------------         ------ ----                                --------------
d-----        1/21/2016   3:54 PM                PowerShell-Linux                    10.123.174.166
d-----       12/23/2015   1:42 PM                jdk                                 10.123.174.166
d-----       12/23/2015   2:07 PM                indicationlog                       10.123.174.166
d-----         2/1/2016   5:53 PM                workspace                           10.123.174.166
------       12/23/2015   1:42 PM      153530841 jdk.sh                              10.123.174.166
------         2/3/2016   2:51 PM            689 pester-tests.xml                    10.123.174.166
------       12/21/2015  11:36 AM            717 README.md                           10.123.174.166
------        1/21/2016   3:41 PM         506256 slave.jar                           10.123.174.166
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Got a recent customer report of this issue.  Don't see a PR linked to this.  Note that it seems the customer was using SSH remoting, so it's likely due to de-serialization complaining as we explicitly removed that member from PSCore6.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
The `HandleCount` property is brought back in `.NET Core 2.0` (both on Windows and Unix platforms), and I have verified that `Get-Process` works fine in both `'PSCore 6.0 -> Windows PowerShell'` and `'Windows PowerShell -> PSCore 6.0'`.

PSCore 6.0 -> Windows PowerShell
---------------------------------------
```
PS:9> Invoke-Command -ComputerName . -ScriptBlock { get-process powershell }

 NPM(K)    PM(M)      WS(M)     CPU(s)     Id  SI ProcessName                           PSComputerName
 ------    -----      -----     ------     --  -- -----------                           --------------
     66    49.13      76.32       2.27 ...044   1 powershell                            localhost
     64    45.30      89.88       6.20 ...000   1 powershell                            localhost
     64    49.38      97.81       3.67 ...720   1 powershell                            localhost
     72    59.50      92.86       2.81 ...504   1 powershell                            localhost
     37    87.11     105.33       1.95 ...208   1 powershell                            localhost

[E:\pscore]
PS:10> Invoke-Command -ComputerName . -ScriptBlock { $PSVersionTable }

Name                           Value
----                           -----
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
PSVersion                      5.1.15063.483
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
BuildVersion                   10.0.15063.483
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
PSEdition                      Desktop
```
Windows PowerShell -> PSCore 6.0
---------------------------------------
```
PS:7> Invoke-Command -ComputerName . -ConfigurationName powershell.6.0.0-beta.3 -ScriptBlock { Get-Process powershell }

Handles  NPM(K)    PM(K)      WS(K)     CPU(s)     Id  SI ProcessName                    PSComputerName
-------  ------    -----      -----     ------     --  -- -----------                    --------------
    659      66    50304      78172       2.27 ...044   1 powershell                     localhost
    862      64    46428      92088       6.20 ...000   1 powershell                     localhost
    861      63    50500     100124       3.67 ...720   1 powershell                     localhost
    836      69    60832      97632       2.94 ...504   1 powershell                     localhost
    753      39    90920     109528       2.13 ...208   1 powershell                     localhost
```

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: Given that, I will close this issue as fixed.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: It duplicate #1812 - there you made a great review of the Issue.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @iSazonov Thanks. BTW, the synthesized `HandleCount` has been removed since we moved to .NET Core 2.0 (now that the real one is back in .NET Core).

title: Invoke command "The member "Handlecount" is not present."
